review_title: Great innovative charity to work for!
pros: Very friendly organisation, everyone is so passionate about animal welfare. It’s very fast paced but staff as well as the animals are treated well. Welfare standards for a rescue organisation are exceptional! Everyone from management to animal care staff to volunteers care passionately about helping as many animals as possible. I also love Mayhew’s ethos of trying to prevent animals ending up in rescue and the support they give struggling owners.
cons: Busy and hardworking environment which can be exhausting at times but very rewarding.

Fundraising issues were identified as a problem with Mayhew's annual income which seems strange, as money seems to be spent in the most inappropriate of places especially on high paid senior staff. While high demands are placed on the public to fund these un-needed aspects without open knowledge of where the money is spent, usually ending up with low paid staff paying for items for the animals out of their own wages. People who donate to rescues generally appreciate their money being used in areas of concern and this needs to be a focus of the year ahead. 

Embrace existing ties and local community connections, for example focusing on people you’ve worked with in the past, or local organisations whose clients will recognise your name. Whatever the size of the sponsor, look for a natural opportunity for collaboration, so that the relationship makes sense to donors and is in line with your mission.

Management is terrible, only started a while back and already ready to leave. The people employed know nothing and the place is run by a manager that again has no clue and they are then used as a puppet by a interfering trustee that has no behaviour knowledge and is ruining the place!

review_title: Job satisfaction, great colleagues, animal cuddles!
job_title: Animal Welfare Officer in London, England
pros:
Working for a great cause, helping animals whilst also supporting the community which is immensely rewarding.
Great perks such as low cost veterinary treatment for staff and a day off on your Birthday.
Friendly colleagues and supportive managers
Likeminded people, dedicated to animal welfare
cons: Dip in morale for some following restructure and strategy change. Many feel positive and animal welfare is still at the heart of the organisation.

pros: Working with the animals and the few staff left that actually care about welfare
cons:
Senior management are inexperienced, ill qualified and a running joke. 
The pay is pittance unless you are senior management sitting at a desk telling everyone what to do and not actually doing the work yourself. 
Don’t feel like you can take any concerns to them either because you will be accused of being a liar or questioning their “superior” knowledge.

pros: The animals, the outreach work (when it actually happens).
cons: Blaming the Pandemic on the issues at Mayhew is outrageous. This charity was poorly managed for years and the trustees did nothing to address issues. Now it's being run by the trustees who are inexperienced and things are worse than ever. Such a shame.

review_title: Doesn't care about well being of employees
pros: Up until end of 2020 Mayhew did great work in the community and staff were proud to work there.
cons: Toxic environment. Shameful practices instigated by a few at the top. Staff overworked and underpaid except a few on huge wages. Bitterness everywhere.

review_title: Review of the Mayhew Animal Shelter London
pros: Helping and caring for the animals in the home.
cons: I came here to volunteer my time years ago, whilst I was working towards becoming a trainee vet. Long story short, whilst I was there, someone stole my ID card and used it to scoop out cat food. I wasn't sure if it was a cruel joke, or what, but I didn't stick around to find out. I quietly quit, stopped donating, and went to volunteer somewhere else. Reading all the other comments here about bullying and toxicity, and seeing all the other reviews from workers around the internet, I'm saddened to read this type of behavior is still going on years later...

pros:

good work/life balance

cons: As mentioned in the previous reviews, the work environment is toxic and bullying is rife. People will make up stories about you to management to get you fired, and management will not listen to your side of the story.
